intro: Conanthus hispidus, commonly known as the hairy conanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name and help in reducing water loss. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Conanthus hispidus is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
